column4: I'm trying to apt-get install gnome, but it's complaining bout not being able to find gnome-desktop-environment.
this is 9.10, after an apt-get update & upgrade
are the repos broken?
Is gnome-core installed?
How about gnome-desktop-environment? :o
No gnome-core, it complains about gnome-desktop-environment not being installable.
(sorry, can't copy and paste easily at the moment since I'm stuck on the command-line.)  :p
In my case, I don't have gnome or gnome-desktop-environment installed and yet I'm running Gnome.
ah, odd package names, then.   Installing gnome-core seems to be working. Thanks.
Good. I do have gnome-core installed, also gdm. I think that is about gnome minimal as you can get. Along with few other packages.
I installed via a server CD (all that I had) but would actually like the typical GUI gnome ubuntu install.  Is there a package somewher that will give me that?
this is indeed very minimal. :p
in particular -- what's the litle tool that genrally prompts you to install the non-OSS drivers to speed up graphics?   The current driver is >.<.
You're talking about Hardware Drivers?
Yeah, previously when I ran the non-server Ubuntu, it would prompt me in the GUI to upgrade my drivers for better performance.
What tool is tha?
that*  (Oy, this keyboard!)
jockey -- Or in that case, for the GUI.... jockey-gtk
aha, it's ubuntu-desktop.
Found it. :)
Thanks!
Check your private message.
